javadoc:
Base class that is a container to manage plugins and their actions, and to coordinate the firing of plugin events and tool events. A PluginTool may have visible components supplied by 
ComponentProviders
. These components may be docked within the tool, or moved out into their own windows.

Plugins normally add actions via {@link #addAction(DockingActionIf)}. There is also an alternate method for getting actions to appear in the popup context menu (see {@link #addPopupActionProvider(PopupActionProvider)}). The popup listener mechanism is generally not needed and should only be used in special circumstances (see {@link PopupActionProvider}).

The PluginTool also manages tasks that run in the background, and options used by the plugins.

params.comment: project that contains this tool

params.name: template
params.comment: the template from which to load this tool

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment: Construct a new PluginTool.

params.name: project
params.comment: project that contains the tool

params.name: name
params.comment: the name of the tool

params.name: isDockable
params.comment: true if the tool contains components that can be docked

params.name: hasStatus
params.comment: true if the tool should display a status component

params.name: isModal
params.comment:
true if the tool is modal, meaning that while this tool is visible,
        no other tool or dialog in Ghidra can have focus

methods.name: createDockingWindowManager
methods.comment:
This method exists here, as opposed to inline in the constructor, so that subclasses can
 alter the behavior of the DockingWindowManager construction.

params.name: isDockable
params.comment:
true if the tool contains components that can be
 docked

params.name: hasStatus
params.comment: true if the tool should display a status component

params.name: isModal
params.comment:
true if the tool is modal, meaning that while this tool
 is visible, no other tool or dialog in Ghidra can have focus

return.comment: a new DockingWindowManager

methods.javadoc:
Set the Tool option (GhidraOptions.OPTION_DOCKING_WINDOWS_ON_TOP)
 for whether a docked window will always be shown on top of its parent window.
@param b true means that the docked window will always appear on top of its
 parent window; false means to allow the docked window to be "hidden" under its
 parent dialog

methods.comment:
Set the Tool option (GhidraOptions.OPTION_DOCKING_WINDOWS_ON_TOP)
 for whether a docked window will always be shown on top of its parent window.

params.name: b
params.comment:
true means that the docked window will always appear on top of its
 parent window; false means to allow the docked window to be "hidden" under its
 parent dialog

methods.name: isWindowsOnTop
methods.comment:
Return the value of the Tool option (GhidraOptions.OPTION_DOCKING_WINDOWS_ON_TOP)

return.comment: value of the Tool option, GhidraOptions.OPTION_DOCKING_WINDOWS_ON_TOP

methods.name: execute
methods.comment:
Call the applyTo() method on the given command to make some change to
 the domain object; the command is done in the AWT thread, therefore,
 the command that is to be executed should be a relatively quick operation
 so that the event queue does not appear to "hang." For lengthy
 operations, the command should be done in a background task.

params.name: command
params.comment: command to apply

params.name: obj
params.comment: domain object that the command will be applied to

return.comment: status of the command's applyTo() method

methods.javadoc:
Return whether there is a command being executed
@return true if there is a command being executed
methods.name: isExecutingCommand
methods.comment: Return whether there is a command being executed

return.comment: true if there is a command being executed

methods.javadoc:
@return true if the current thread group or its ancestors is
 a member of this tools background task thread group, else false
methods.name: threadIsBackgroundTaskThread

return.comment:
true if the current thread group or its ancestors is
 a member of this tools background task thread group, else false

methods.javadoc:
Start a new thread that will call the given command's applyTo()
 method to make some change in the domain object. This method should
 be called for an operation that could potentially take a long time to
 complete.
@param cmd command that will be executed in another thread (not the
 AWT Thread)
@param obj domain object that the command will be applied to
methods.name: executeBackgroundCommand
methods.comment:
Start a new thread that will call the given command's applyTo()
 method to make some change in the domain object. This method should
 be called for an operation that could potentially take a long time to
 complete.

params.name: cmd
params.comment:
command that will be executed in another thread (not the
 AWT Thread)

params.name: obj
params.comment: domain object that the command will be applied to

methods.javadoc:
Cancel any running command and clear the command queue.
@param wait if true wait for current task to cancel cleanly
methods.name: terminateBackgroundCommands
methods.comment: Cancel any running command and clear the command queue.

params.name: wait
params.comment: if true wait for current task to cancel cleanly

methods.name: scheduleFollowOnCommand
methods.comment:
Add the given background command to a queue that is processed after the
 main background command completes.

params.name: cmd
params.comment: background command to submit

params.name: obj
params.comment: the domain object to be modified by the command.

methods.javadoc:
Get the options for the given category name; if no options exist with

Get the options for the given category name; if no options exist with

methods.name: registerOptionsNameChange
methods.comment:
Updates saved options from an old name to a new name.  NOTE: this must be called before

params.name: oldName
params.comment: the old name of the options.

params.name: newName
params.comment: the new name of the options.

methods.javadoc:
Close this tool:
  1. if there are no tasks running.
  2. resolve the state of any plugins so they can be closed.
  3. Prompt the user to save any changes.
  4. close all associated plugins (this closes the domain object if one is open).
  5. pop up dialog to save the configuration if it has changed.
  6. notify the project tool services that this tool is going away.
methods.name: close
methods.comment:
Close this tool:
 
 	if there are no tasks running.
 	resolve the state of any plugins so they can be closed.
 	Prompt the user to save any changes.
 	close all associated plugins (this closes the domain object if one is open).
 	pop up dialog to save the configuration if it has changed.
 	notify the project tool services that this tool is going away.

methods.javadoc:
Close this tool:
  1. if there are no tasks running.
  2. close all associated plugins (this closes the domain object if one is open).
  3. pop up dialog to save the configuration if it has changed;
  4. notify the project tool services that this tool is going away.
methods.name: doClose
methods.comment:
Close this tool:
 
 	if there are no tasks running.
 	close all associated plugins (this closes the domain object if one is open).
 	pop up dialog to save the configuration if it has changed;
 	notify the project tool services that this tool is going away.

methods.javadoc:
Called when it is time to save the tool.  Handles auto-saving logic.
@return true if a save happened
methods.name: doSaveTool
methods.comment: Called when it is time to save the tool.  Handles auto-saving logic.

return.comment: true if a save happened

methods.javadoc:
Can this tool be closed?
Note: This forces plugins to terminate any tasks they have running and apply any unsaved data to domain objects or files. If they can't do this or the user cancels then this returns false. @return false if this tool has tasks in progress or can't be closed since the user has unfinished/unsaved changes.
methods.name: canClose
methods.comment:
Can this tool be closed?
 Note: This forces plugins to terminate any tasks they have running and
 apply any unsaved data to domain objects or files. If they can't do
 this or the user cancels then this returns false.

return.comment:
false if this tool has tasks in progress or can't be closed
 since the user has unfinished/unsaved changes.

methods.javadoc:
Can the domain object be closed?
Note: This forces plugins to terminate any tasks they have running for the indicated domain object and apply any unsaved data to the domain object. If they can't do this or the user cancels then this returns false. @param domainObject the domain object to check @return false any of the plugins reports that the domain object should not be closed
methods.name: canCloseDomainObject
methods.comment:
Can the domain object be closed?
 Note: This forces plugins to terminate any tasks they have running for the
 indicated domain object and apply any unsaved data to the domain object. If they can't do
 this or the user cancels then this returns false.

params.name: domainObject
params.comment: the domain object to check

return.comment:
false any of the plugins reports that the domain object
 should not be closed

methods.name: prepareToSave
methods.comment:
Called when the domain object is about to be saved; this allows any plugin that has
 a cache to flush out to the domain object.

params.name: dobj
params.comment: domain object that is about to be saved

methods.comment: Sets the size of the tool's main window

params.name: width
params.comment: width in pixels

params.name: height
params.comment: height in pixels

methods.javadoc:
Return the dimension of this tool's frame.
@return dimension of this tool's frame
methods.name: getSize
methods.comment: Return the dimension of this tool's frame.

return.comment: dimension of this tool's frame

methods.comment: Set the location of this tool's frame on the screen.

params.name: x
params.comment: screen x coordinate

params.name: y
params.comment: screen y coordinate

methods.javadoc:
Return the location of this tool's frame on the screen.
@return location of this tool's frame
methods.name: getLocation
methods.comment: Return the location of this tool's frame on the screen.

return.comment: location of this tool's frame

methods.name: removeEventListener
methods.comment:
Remove the event listener by className; the plugin registered
 for events, but the construction failed.

params.name: className
params.comment: class name of the plugin that is the event listener

methods.name: showEditWindow
methods.comment: Display an text edit box on top of the specified component.

params.name: defaultText
params.comment: initial text to be displayed in edit box

params.name: comp
params.comment: component over which the edit box will be placed

params.name: rect
params.comment:
specifies the bounds of the edit box relative to the
 component.  The height is ignored.  The default text field height
 is used as the preferred height.

params.name: listener
params.comment:
when the edit is complete, this listener is notified
 with the new text.  The edit box is dismissed prior to notifying
 the listener.

methods.javadoc: Cancel the current task in the tool.
methods.name: cancelCurrentTask
methods.comment: Cancel the current task in the tool.

methods.javadoc:
Shows the dialog using the tool's currently active window as a parent.  Also,
 remembers any size and location adjustments made by the user for the next
 time the dialog is shown.
@param dialogComponent the DialogComponentProvider object to be shown in a dialog.
methods.name: showDialogOnActiveWindow
methods.comment:
Shows the dialog using the tool's currently active window as a parent.  Also,
 remembers any size and location adjustments made by the user for the next
 time the dialog is shown.

params.name: dialogComponent
params.comment: the DialogComponentProvider object to be shown in a dialog.

methods.name: showDialog
methods.comment:
Shows the dialog using the window containing the given componentProvider as its parent window.
 Remembers the last location and size of this dialog for the next time it is shown.

params.name: dialogComponent
params.comment: the DialogComponentProvider object to be shown in a dialog.

params.name: centeredOnProvider
params.comment:
the component provider that is used to find a parent window for this dialog.
 The dialog is centered on this component provider's component.

methods.name: showDialog
methods.comment:
Shows the dialog using the tool's parent frame, but centers the dialog on the given
 component

params.name: dialogComponent
params.comment: the DialogComponentProvider object to be shown in a dialog.

params.name: centeredOnComponent
params.comment: the component on which to center the dialog.

name: PluginTool
comment:
Base class that is a container to manage plugins and their actions, and to coordinate the 
 firing of plugin events and tool events. A PluginTool may have visible components supplied by
 ComponentProviders . These components may be docked within the tool, or moved 
 out into their own windows.

 Plugins normally add actions via #addAction(DockingActionIf).   There is also 
 an alternate method for getting actions to appear in the popup context menu (see
 #addPopupActionProvider(PopupActionProvider)).   The popup listener mechanism is generally not
 needed and should only be used in special circumstances (see PopupActionProvider).
 
 The PluginTool also manages tasks that run in the background, and options used by the plugins.
